result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Cory R. Renard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Attend and successfully complete alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant to be subject to random and frequent testing to verify abstinence.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant to be subject to random and frequent testing to verify abstinence.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to drive without agent's consent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to drive without agent's consent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory R. Renard

defendant.name: Renard, Cory R.
defendant.address: W12594 E. Town House Road, Alma Center, WI 54611

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  DA Fox moves to withdraw motion to revoke DPA.  Granted.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  State moved to amend Count 2 to a misdemeanor.  Defendant to plead as follows:  Guilty to Counts 1, amended Count 2 and Count 3.   Clerk interrupted proceedings stating that the defendant had already plead to counts 1 and 3 and was on probation for those counts.  DA and defense will discuss the cases further to craft a new sentence.  Sentencing scheduled for 3/2/15 at 1:30 pm
Status conference on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.
of Charles Betthauser in Support of Motion to Withdraw as Attorney.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: to Revoke Negotiated Plea and Diversion Agreement.
Plea hearing on August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent.
